page.title: 03Children's Outdoor Games
page.content: The games played by children are very varied mixing the traditional with the modern. Chasing games are very popular and come under many different titles: Cops-and-Robbers, Donkey Tick and Witches Pot. They all have one child trying to capture other children and placing them in some sort of den, circles drawn on the ground for example. Ball games are also popular. Football and cricket are easily played on any open ground. Ball tick games are many and varied. There are some pavement games still being played. Hop-scotch and mine fields are examples, where paving stones are used as stepping stones. Stepping on the wrong pavement means losing the game. 25% of the children surveyed played outdoor games often.
